jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

6DACC3A91E9F429EA7B090CF1F6FE0D9.description:
Recognize that some words are fingerspelled due to
domain-specific definition.

591B9B17BA964F4095CB59AB68AD5344.description:
Use signs compounded with signs and lexicalized
fingerspelling.

4055AF4575D04F3F9B24B7258A507CC6.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

D573656E85CD4913A48F26C13B2613C7.description:
Connect initialized forms and alphabet letters to their
equivalent in English.

0F5054D5AA78449B813AAC96064291CD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

AD32A96363714DED8CACAE0E9FC67BCF.description: Use fingerspelled words when there are no sign equivalents.

A5181D277CDB4E4386593440CB88F7EF.description:
Use fingerspelled words for emphasis though pacing,
chunking, and/or spatial.

B330C3174A3042258629DCF5DFEB4492.description:
Understand that fingerspelling is used for various purposes,
formally and informally.

F9D34C4E33CB49C6BC74A98E3112CB0D.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general
academic and domain-specific signs, fingerspelled words,
and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering
signs, fingerspelled words, or phrases important to
comprehension or expression.

93BB82C439D4495C8AA32D56361ED275.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of
signs with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., RESPECT,
HONOR, LOOK-UP).

60FEB3CEBFC043DEA9A65E9DBDDF3F12.description:
Use relationships between particular sign choices (e.g.,
synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of
the concepts/signs.

92B60F235E464C1F944E38618EAD79F2.description:
Interpret figurative language in context (e.g., literary,
biblical, and mythological allusions).

0232DCBC88EE484EAB2473B94BF520E3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, sign
relationships, and nuances in sign meanings.

2D9AE136CE3E4FE3AFC35406ACBD5E0B.description:
Verify the meaning of a sign, depiction, or phrase (e.g.,
by checking the inferred meaning in context or other
accessible resource).

12C3B99994C04E47880C4823BE82A636.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g.,
general dictionaries and content-specific references), both
print and digital, to determine and clarify its meaning.

74D0BD435070408E9B304F8641D01DEE.description:
Use context (e.g., cause/effect relationships and
comparisons in text) as a clue to the meaning of a sign,
fingerspelled word, classifier, or phrase.

333EF671A7144FD3AF9B08CF97E66382.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning signs, fingerspelled words, spatial use, and phrases
based on grade 7 viewing and content, choosing flexibly from
a range of strategies.

21AF80C873A74815A2C0941E5B0D5612.description:
Fingerspell correctly and use a chaining approach when
introducing new academic signs.

775049004DB147269E59DF2D3E0FB0C1.description:
Vary sentence patterns for meaning, viewer interest, and
style.

1B6C570DE4314C46BBAB3F961073F324.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

5E60C5E00DE44A00B20DD112660F82C0.description:
Demonstrate command of the standard ASL grammar and
usage when signing (live and published).

3D943B11942F4B139956FB37186CA1F7.description:
Adapt signs to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating
command of formal ASL when indicated or appropriate. (See
grade 7 Language standards for specific expectations.)

C1AF2D9E48994C9D837FD233EEF879E7.description:
Include multimedia components and visual displays in
presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize
salient points.

D10F687E19194229B1DAFCE46BBFC923.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in
a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions,
facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact,
appropriate signing space, and clear production.

838C2307CEEE4E48A55BCDD75406878B.description:
Delineate a signer’s argument and specific claims, evaluating
the strength of the reasoning and the relevance and
sufficiency of the evidence.

60FEEB668D6B40C08EA8ED8A398912D5.description:
Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in
diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) and
explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study

794179E6E12F4D9D848D76FAB2030263.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others and,
when warranted, modify their own views.

E916B7909A7C4D84AAD94AF78F698056.description:
Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’
questions and comments with relevant observations and
ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

FF1520D6BDFD47E89DB6E5E49D42967A.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward
specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as
needed.

7A30B4678CB54391B66B3F5DA62439C7.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or researched
material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation
by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe
and reflect on ideas under discussion.

330588A56C334C2FBC534E25D70DAD6B.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher-led) with diverse partners on
grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

23ED7D7194F140D79A7F30546C6F0454.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames
(e.g., a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of disciplinespecific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

B14D187CF9F84BE69890A350A6B21DBD.description:
Apply grade 7 Viewing standards to literary nonfiction (e.g.,
“Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in
a text, assessing whether the reasoning is solid and the
evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.”).

9FCC66F557FC46DC8CB9C77CF48DE93B.description:
Apply grade 7 Viewing standards to literature (e.g.,
“Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place,
or character and a historical account of the same period
as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or
alter history.”).

63181DBBF5E74D658CF0A344F6179866.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and research.

0963C563EA3841CEB1C6CC89668CE8C2.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple published
and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess
the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or
paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding
plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

47AB25952A604CE38ED7B703223ACD6F.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question,
drawing on several sources and generating additional related,
focused questions for further research and investigation.

E42564AFD2744C2D8F4FEE1F47FD495F.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

06B0ACDE34554FAD930B96958AAD6B37.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish
signing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and
collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources

AB4F4A3CFD0B476898327053F59435B7.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults,
develop and strengthen signing as needed by planning,
revising, editing, re-signing, or trying a new approach, focusing
on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.
(Editing for structure should demonstrate command of
Language standards 1-3.)

989ADBE79BFA4657A0304FBE6AC04E6A.description:
Produce clear and coherent signing in which the development,
organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and
audience. (Grade-specific expectations for signing types are
defined in standards 1-3 above.)

5BCCB49310434514A9589C755538736E.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

832AD9FF9B164D2E9882492B323AA216.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the
narrated experiences or events.

84DF12DA77F741B489534CBA80F4DEA1.description:
Use precise signs, depiction, and phrases, relevant
descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the
action and convey experiences and events.

4C0F2B05C2474A3C8FAF031B71F38DCD.description:
Use a variety of transition signs, phrases, and clauses to
convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or
setting to another.

3280F02BF6354225AE4057F324B3A294.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and
description, to develop experiences, events, and/or
characters.

CB977C9F7E0E4AF0B8C9787FC787582B.description:
Engage and orient the viewer by establishing a context and
point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters;
organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and
logically.

74FA1E8CF652430BB1D034EB42A44A0E.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details,
and well-structured event sequences.

4AA435E968CF4C9C82E130D9891DB019.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

2E13C9894C444B79ABDFC6DB3B1C0A5B.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
and supports the information or explanation presented.

83FD0CCDD35946049A4783E3196572A2.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to
inform about or explain the topic.

C2377BC949704D6BB7CC39E646A62B2F.description:
Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the
relationships among ideas and concepts.

E6F9E315BEB3476CBFB22F5F264F0E88.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete
details, quotations, or other information and examples.

155632F9D48C45E69D2445C5CD7C3602.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow;
organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies
such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and
cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics
(e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding
comprehension.

C1632044D6E54ABAACD7BA96659294CF.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

2CDD6B64DD2D433CAE3F4B452483247F.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

BC37F647DFED49359346C38A2E4FD917.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from
and supports the argument presented.

6334B14291C24B3FBA841EE39A7A4C5A.description:
Use words, phrases, depiction, and clauses to create cohesion
and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and
evidence.

F00C355E020B4E8281D4B8101F8755D1.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant
evidence, using accurate, credible sources and
demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

42F7F49A97A34B8A812B717A401477AE.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing
claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

C94CDE625A804F32B05C6D1B15871FAB.description:
Sign arguments to support claims with clear reasons and
relevant evidence.

F3513E0573D04A67A53912E325143AA2.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literary
nonfiction in the grades 6-8 text complexity band proficiently,
with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

6DEA4F737AD344188F5FE63DF76763C0.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

43889E300B5341849EF3C0A9AB5861BD.description:
Analyze how two or more authors signing about the same
topic shape their presentations of key information by
emphasizing different evidence or advancing different
interpretations of facts.

2070E969A2B24F6FA918ABE8C1C169C7.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text,
assessing whether the reasoning is solid and the evidence is
relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

5E7DB7006E8445FABCCED1646D38DF8D.description:
Compare and contrast a text to a video or multimedia version
of the text, analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject
(e.g., how the delivery of a presentation affects the impact of
sign choices).

07A2FCF29FFD49B48E148A58A9B22BD9.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and
analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from
that of others.

E9118EBA237E4895BF4AEF10C7F31FA7.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text,
including how the major sections contribute to the whole and
to the development of the ideas.

DD9420DA4B4F4FD2AF674D77B6F7D03B.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are
used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical
meanings; analyze the impact of a specific sign choice on
meaning and tone.

017EEE6345324B3DB6C467C1ECD3454D.description:
Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and
ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events,
or how individuals influence ideas or events).

CEA45C04DF6F4169B6738A7257CA77AC.description:
Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze
their development over the course of the text; provide an
objective summary of the text.

01E64C7EB5244F23BE413A19ED8B2E3C.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of
what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from
the text.

534C6EF74C06492BB9B29226CBBB181D.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poems, in the grades 6-8 text
complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at
the high end of the range.

D79FE4DC6D594BDD9E98A18860CC1CE7.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

9D9B4E9747D8483AAC1F8C9C17EB4859.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place,
or character and a historical account of the same period as a
means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter
history.

2AE918BBC2FF4C6E9A3812179A63BF24.description:
Compare and contrast a story, drama, or poem to its filmed,
staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of
techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, color, or
camera focus and angles in a film).

7DF5A3F1380345B288AC345B6F903B83.description:
Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of
view of different characters or narrators in a text.

B45DC65DA0B449598544EE1242AAACF9.description:
Analyze how a drama’s or poem’s form or structure (e.g.,
soliloquy, free verse) contributes to its meaning.

0B6341CC68BA4FC7B8DC5199184761CD.description:
Determine the meaning of signs and phrases as they are used
in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings;
analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of signs
(e.g., repeated parameters) on a specific verse or stanza of a
poem or section of a story or drama.

61A29E4C828841A992D00554C57F4F1C.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact
(e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

52CDBA58A6D947C29F26C0DF161E81FA.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its
development over the course of the text; provide an objective
summary of the text.

E89FC79D09FD4370A7B5E7027723C50F.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of
what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from
the text.
